rounds.observation:
[GAME] Hello Player 0! You're playing in a friendly 2-player Texas Hold'em Poker game.
The goal is simple: use your poker skills to win chips and outlast your opponents.
Game Setup:
- Number of hands: 10
- Your starting chips: 1000
- Blinds: 10/20

Just specify your actions using these exact commands:
  '[Check]'  - when no one has bet yet
  '[Call]'   - to match someone's bet
  '[Fold]'   - to give up your cards
  '[Bet N]'  - to start betting N chips
  '[Raise N]'- to raise the bet by N chips

Invalid actions will result in retries. Use exact bracket format and ensure you have sufficient chips for bets/raises. Check when facing a bet is invalid.
[GAME] Starting a new 10-round Texas Hold'em game with 2 players.
[GAME] ===== Hand 1 / 10 - Pre‑flop =====
Pot: 30 | Current bet: 20
Visible board: []
P0 (Dealer/BB): 990.00 chips | bet 10.00 | active
P1 (SB): 980.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: 4♠, J♥
==============================================
rounds.response:
[GAME] I am in the Big Blind (BB) with J♥ 4♠.
Action is on me to respond after P1 (SB) raised me to 20.
Pot is 30 chips, cost to me is an additional 10 chips. 4-spades is off suit and low; Jack is medium strength but unsuited & off-gapped, making only one very weak overcard. Even heads-up, continuing costs 10 out of 990 remaining chips, giving implied odds of 3-to-1; holding J4o is below standard defend range.

[Fold]
